These are weapons of war, designed to kill as many people as possible. They simply don’t belong on our streets, in our communities. I am proud to cosponsor H.R.1296, led by @DavidCicilline, to ban assault weapons once and for all. 2/2

The Voting Rights Act is a bedrock of our democracy. Since 2013, is has come under unprecedented attack after the Supreme Court weakened key protections. I’m proud to cosponsor the Voting Rights Advancement Act to #RestoreTheVOTE

Too many Americans struggle with high and rising healthcare costs. I’m proud to work with my colleagues to protect those with preexisting conditions and to lower drug costs. As the administration tries to repeal the ACA through the courts, we’re fighting back! #ProtectOurCare

This weekend we saw white nationalist terrorism, facilitated by powerful military style rifles. These weapons of war have no place in civilian hands. We also need to take racist violence and radicalism far more seriously. This is a critical national security issue.

We ARE the only developed country where weapons of war are so freely available, where actors like the NRA block any effort to pass crucial reforms. We can’t accept this any more. The Senate MUST pass H.R.8 and H.R.1112 NOW! 3/3

Last week saw the 29th anniversary of the Americans With Disabilities Act. This vital legislation has helped to ensure dignity and respect to millions, but we must commit ourselves to work every day to continue to empower and support all people with disabilities.

I’m sick of robocalls. You probably are too. Robocalls aren’t just  a nuisance—scammers can do real harm to innocent people. Last week, the House passed the Stopping Bad Robocalls Act to crack down and end the harassment once and for all! I was a proud cosponsor.

No one who works full time should live in poverty. Congress passed the Raise the Wage Act to responsibly raise the minimum wage to $15 by 2025. We can lift 1.3 million people out of poverty. Another 33 million will get a raise. Senator McConnell must pass this now!

The fight against climate change will define our future. We need to mobilize to cut dangerous carbon pollution and to prepare for the impacts of extreme weather and sea level rise. We can’t keep putting the needs of polluters and special interests first. #ClimateCrisis
